title: Russian Aluminum Giant’s Owner Considers Splitting Foreign Operations
sub_head: EN+ reviews Rusal strategy in wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
body:
The controlling shareholder of Rusal , Russia’s largest aluminum producer, said it was exploring a separation of the company’s international operations and that its British chairman was stepping down.
The dual announcements from EN+ Group International PJSC come as the war in Ukraine causes various challenges for companies operating in Russia, prompting some Western-based businesses to re-evaluate their presence in the region.
